BTN

class commonroad_crime.measure.index.btn.BTN(config: CriMeConfiguration)[source]

Bases: CriMeBase

the relation between the negative acceleration needed to marginally avoid a collision and the maximum deceleration available for the vehicle.

– from Åsljung, Daniel, Jonas Nilsson, and Jonas Fredriksson. “Using extreme value theory for vehicle level safety validation and implications for autonomous vehicles.” IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Vehicles 2.4 (2017): 288-297.

compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0)[source]

Specific computing function for each measure

measure_name: Enum = 'brake threat number'
monotone: Enum = 'positive monotonic'
visualize()[source]

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.

STN

class commonroad_crime.measure.index.stn.STN(config: CriMeConfiguration)[source]

Bases: CriMeBase

the ratio between the requested lateral acceleration (due to steering) and the maximum achievable lateral acceleration is denoted as the steering threat number (STN).

– from Hosseini, SeyedMehrdad, et al. “Adaptive forward collision warning algorithm for automotive applications.” 2016 American Control Conference (ACC). IEEE, 2016.

compute(vehicle_id: int, time_step: int = 0)[source]

Specific computing function for each measure

measure_name: Enum = 'steer threat number'
monotone: Enum = 'positive monotonic'
visualize()[source]

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.

TCI

class commonroad_crime.measure.index.tci.TCI(config: CriMeConfiguration)[source]

Bases: CriMeBase

the Trajectory Criticality Index (TCI) models criticality using an optimization problem. The task is to find a minimum difficulty value, i.e. how demanding even the easiest option for the vehicle will be under a set of physical and regulatory constraints.

– from P. Junietz, F. Bonakdar, B. Klamann, and H. Winner, “Criticality metric for the safety validation of automated driving using model predictive trajectory optimization,” in 21st International Conference on Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITSC), pp. 60–65, IEEE, 2018.

compute(time_step: int = 0, vehicle_id=None)[source]

Specific computing function for each measure

measure_name: Enum = 'trajectory criticality index'
visualize()[source]

Visualize the result, which will be measure-dependent.
